CatDescriptText: Ida Jean Gray, secretary, Homewood and Bernice Kelly, stenographer, East End were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, September 24, 1960, pg. A1 with question "Do you believe there should be another Negro judge in the local state courts - Allegheny County Court and the Common Pleas Court of Allegheny County?"  Ms. Gray's answer reads: "I certainly am in favor of it.  The number of cases handled by the number of judges makes them overworked and therefore another judge is needed."  Ms. Kelly's answer reads: "Yes, I do. I don't think there are enough colored judges for the county.  There are a lot of Negro attorneys and I believe that by having more Negro judges this will help them out."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Ida Jean Gray wearing dark dress with light colored polka dot up turned cuffs and collar, standing in front of row of stores; Portrait of Bernice Kelly wearing light colored cowl neck dress, standing with arms crossed in front of building with striped pole
